Core Data Structures

Node Class

class gli.data_structures.Node(id: str | int, attributes: ~typing.Dict[str, ~typing.Any] = <factory>)[source]

Bases: object

Graph node with attributes

The Node class represents a graph vertex with associated attributes. It supports both string and integer IDs.

__init__(id: str | int, attributes: ~typing.Dict[str, ~typing.Any] = <factory>) → None

Type Support

Nodes support flexible ID types:

# String IDs
node1 = Node("alice", {"age": 30, "city": "NYC"})

# Integer IDs
node2 = Node(42, {"value": 100, "category": "important"})

Attribute Access

Nodes support dict-like attribute access:

node = Node("alice", {"age": 30, "city": "NYC"})

# Dict-like access
print(node["age"])          # 30
print(node.get("job", ""))  # "" (default)
node["job"] = "Engineer"

# Check membership
if "age" in node:
    print("Node has age attribute")

# Iteration
for key in node:
    print(f"{key}: {node[key]}")

# Get all items
for key, value in node.items():
    print(f"{key}: {value}")
__init__(id: str | int, attributes: ~typing.Dict[str, ~typing.Any] = <factory>) → None
attributes: Dict[str, Any]
get(key: str, default=None)[source]
get_attribute(key: str, default=None)[source]
id: str | int
items()[source]
keys()[source]
set_attribute(key: str, value: Any)[source]
values()[source]

Edge Class

class gli.data_structures.Edge(source: str | int, target: str | int, attributes: ~typing.Dict[str, ~typing.Any] = <factory>)[source]

Bases: object

Graph edge with attributes

The Edge class represents a graph edge connecting two nodes. It supports mixed node ID types.

__init__(source: str | int, target: str | int, attributes: ~typing.Dict[str, ~typing.Any] = <factory>) → None

Usage Example

edge = Edge("alice", "bob", {
    "relationship": "friends",
    "since": 2020,
    "strength": 0.9
})

print(edge.source)          # "alice"
print(edge.target)          # "bob"
print(edge["relationship"]) # "friends"
__init__(source: str | int, target: str | int, attributes: ~typing.Dict[str, ~typing.Any] = <factory>) → None
attributes: Dict[str, Any]
get(key: str, default=None)[source]
get_attribute(key: str, default=None)[source]
property id
items()[source]
keys()[source]
set_attribute(key: str, value: Any)[source]
source: str | int
target: str | int
values()[source]

Attribute Management

Both Node and Edge classes provide consistent attribute management:

Common Methods

Node.get_attribute(key: str, default=None)[source]
Node.set_attribute(key: str, value: Any)[source]

Dict-like Interface

All data structures support Pythons dict protocol:

  • obj[key] - Get attribute value

  • obj[key] = value - Set attribute value

  • key in obj - Check if attribute exists

  • obj.get(key, default) - Get with default

  • obj.keys() - Get all attribute names

  • obj.values() - Get all attribute values

  • obj.items() - Get key-value pairs

Immutability

Data structures support immutable updates:

node = Node("alice", {"age": 30})
new_node = node.set_attribute("age", 31)  # Returns new instance
# original node unchanged
